title: "The Tyranny of the Mean"
date: "2020-07-01"
draft: true
---

As data scientists, we often have a laser-focus on the problem at hand. It usually boils down to increasing or decreasing a group summary statistic like the mean. However, differences in a population mean often don't reflect the full picture of individual lived experiences within that population.

Example: Follow a group of 100 students who want to become physicians.
